snippet: The role of a presidential debate moderator, a task that once stood as a crowning and coveted journalistic achievement, is now subject to partisan rancor.
abstract: Role of a presidential debate moderator, a task that once stood as a coveted journalistic achievement, is now subject to partisan rancor, making the stress of hosting the politically charged event heavier than ever; four debate moderators, Jim Lehrer, Candy Crowley, Martha Raddatz and Bob Schieffer, have their own ways of preparation and dealing with the pressure.
lead_paragraph: The role of a presidential debate moderator, a task that once stood as a crowning and coveted journalistic achievement, is now subject to partisan rancor.

headline.seo: Debate Moderators Are Subject to Partisan Rancor
headline.main: Playing Roles of Referee and, Increasingly, Target During Debates
headline.print_headline: Playing Roles of Referee and, Increasingly, Target During Debates
